ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] queue counting is buggy
ygData.msgSnippet: Good catch -- URIs deferred to allow prerequisites to finish shouldn t draw down the budget. However, doing a refund for all needsRetrying URIs would

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] queue counting is buggy
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=bg9cERIbmvbVcsl4eegGWl5b65G3lUId4NdYip5-UypN

Good catch -- URIs 'deferred' to allow prerequisites
to finish shouldn't draw down the budget.

However, doing a 'refund' for all 'needsRetrying' URIs
would also refund the cost of URIs that were tried but
encountered network errors. We want those to have a cost,
so that repeated network errors eventually cause the
whole queue to be rotated out of 'active' status or
retired altogether.

So something like...

     if(curi.getFetchStatus()==S_DEFERRED) {
         wq.refund(getCost(curi));
     }

...would make more sense, at least as long as it's only
S_DEFERRED URIs that shouldn't (yet) cost anything.

I've made a bug for this issue:

   [ 1255137 ] Deferred URI should be 'free' (no cost against queue budget)
   https://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1255137&group_id=73833&atid=539099

...and will apply the fix above right away.

- Gordon @ IA

Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> So - I have digged a little into the code (HEAD)
> I think that WorkQueueFrontier.finished(...) needs this:
> 
> wq.refund(getCost(curi));
> 
> when handling:  'if (needsRetrying(curi)) {...}' (line 767-786)
> 
> just like when handling disregarded URIs
> Am I mistaken ??
> 
> best
> Bjarne
> 
> Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> 
>>URI's that hit crawledURINeedRetry(CrawlURI curi) in
>>StatisticsTracker.java because of prerequisits still missing (dns: &
>>robots.txt) are using from the queue-budget !!
>>
>>So if you the a queue-total-budget to 50 something around 45-48 objects
>>will typically be fetched
>>
>>Could such URI's not use from the budget ?? (since they are never
>>fetched but just put back on the URI-queue)
>>
>>We use the queue-total-budget in all crawls and want it to be as
>>accurate as possible
>>
>>best
>>--
